content:
The **Vinyasa Vibes** playlist is designed to match the dynamic flow of a Vinyasa class, with a mix of upbeat indie-rock, electronic, and world music to keep you moving. Here are some specific song recommendations from that playlist that would be great for a 10-15 minute morning practice:

**Warm-Up (2-3 minutes)**

1. **"First Day of My Life" by Bright Eyes** - A gentle, upbeat track to get you moving and set the tone for your practice.
2. **"Sweet Disposition" by The Temper Trap** - A catchy, indie-rock tune with a soaring chorus to get your energy flowing.

**Sun Salutations (3-4 minutes)**

1. **"Pumped Up Kicks" by Foster the People** - A fun, upbeat track with a great beat to match your Surya Namaskars.
2. **"Mr. Brightside" by The Killers** - A classic indie-rock anthem to keep you moving and energized.

**Standing Postures (4-5 minutes)**

1. **"Best Day of My Life" by American Authors** - A catchy, indie-pop track with a great energy to keep you engaged.
2. **"On Top of the World" by Imagine Dragons** - A high-energy track with a strong beat to match your standing postures.

**Balancing and Flexibility (3-4 minutes)**

1. **"Get Lucky" by Daft Punk ft. Pharrell Williams** - A funky, upbeat track to keep you moving and grooving.
2. **"Electric" by Alina Baraz ft. Khalid** - A chill, electronic track with a great vibe for slower, more introspective movements.

**Final Savasana (2-3 minutes)**

1. **"Home" by Edward Sharpe & The Magnetic Zeros** - A folky, upbeat track to bring your practice full circle.
2. **"Breathe Me" by Sia** - A hauntingly beautiful track to calm your mind and body for Savasana.

Remember, these are just suggestions - feel free to experiment and find the perfect playlist that resonates with you and your practice!
